intro: Peristrophe floribunda, commonly known as the flowering peristrophe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
